properties.areaDesc: Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake; Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties; Greater Reno-Carson City-Minden Area
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 2 at 8:04PM PST by NWS Reno NV
properties.description:
Icy spots may develop on area roads tonight and persist into
Monday morning in parts of western Nevada, which received up to
an inch of snow Sunday afternoon and evening. If the snow melted
but has not yet dried, patches of ice could form as road surface
temperatures drop below freezing, resulting in hazardous travel
conditions overnight and early Monday. This includes areas around
Fernley and Wadsworth, and also Fallon and Lovelock. Icy spots
could also develop from Minden to Topaz Lake, and across the Smith
and Mason Valleys in southern Lyon County from the snow which fell
mainly after sunset.

In addition, snow showers are possible off Pyramid Lake through
the night. This could rapidly lower the visibility on Interstate
80 around Wadsworth and Fernley and make travel hazardous.

Anyone venturing out tonight or early Monday morning should use
extreme care as icy spots may be hard to recognize at night.

NWSheadline: Icy Spots Possible in Western Nevada Tonight into Monday Morning
